structural_unit_name.en: School of Economics and Business Administration

description.en: Bachelor Seminar generalizes and deepens students' knowledge of scientific research.
description.et: Bakalaureuseseminar üldistab ja süvendab üliõpilaste teadmisi teadusliku uurimistöö tegemiseks.

objectives.en: The aim of Bachelor Seminar is to systematize basic knowledge of conducting scientific research.
objectives.et: Bakalaureuseseminari eesmärgiks on teadusliku uurimistöö alaste põhiteadmiste süstematiseerimine.

learning_outcomes.en: Student who have passed the course:
- knows the main features of the scientific approach, the process of academic research and the basic concepts of scientific ethics;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab teadusliku lähenemisviisi iseärasusi, tunneb akadeemilise uurimistöö protsessi ning teaduseetika põhimõisteid;

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to independently find relevant scientific literature, can write an analytical literature review and is able to correctly refer to the sources used;
learning_outcomes.et: - on võimeline iseseisvalt leidma erialast teaduskirjandust, oskab koostada kirjanduse ülevaadet ning kasutatud allikatele korrektselt viidata;

learning_outcomes.en: - has knowledge of methods for collecting and analyzing quantitative and qualitative data;
learning_outcomes.et: - omab teadmisi kvantitatiivsete ja kvalitatiivsete andmete kogumise ja analüüsimise meetoditest;

learning_outcomes.en: - has knowledge of presenting research results to the audience.
learning_outcomes.et: - omab teadmisi uurimistöö tulemuste esitlemisest auditooriumile.

description.et: Practical assignments will be given in every seminar. Participation and submission of assignments is required (pre-requisite to get to the pre-defence). Detailed instructions are in the Moodle.
Pre-defence of bachelor thesis. Assessed on a scale passed / not passed.

debt_elimination.et: To retake the course next year

name.en: Chair of Public Economics and Policy

description.et: 23. week: Deadline to sign up for BA thesis or BA exam in SIS/ÕIS;  Registering BA thesis topic and supervisor in Moodle
29. week: Feedback to current versions of bachelor's theses  (14.15-18)
29. week: Feedback to current versions of bachelor's theses ( from 13.15 to 17 o'clock)
32. week: Analysis of future work skills and career planning (14.15-16)
36. week: Consultancy and rehearsal for graduation exam (13.15-15)
